intro: Cynanchum cyathiforme, commonly known as the narrow-leaved milkvetch, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae, which is characterized by its milky sap and showy flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters, with slender stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or greenish-yellow, arranged in clusters, and are followed by elongated, cylindrical fruits. Cynanchum cyathiforme is adapted to harsh environmental conditions and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
